description.narrative: The objectives of the Free Education Project for Sierra Leone are to improve the management of the education system, teaching practices, and learning conditions. The Project has five components. 1. Policy, Governance, Accountability, and System Administration component will strengthen the education system in areas of policy, governance, accountability, and administration. This component has three subcomponents. 1.1. Evidence-based Education Planning and Rationalization subcomponent entails: (a) Annual and medium-term Education Sector Plan (ESP) development and budgeting; (b) School catchment area and rationalization plan and formula-based school funding; (c) Reform of government school approval and financing criterion and process; (d) Education data and management system; (e) Schools Standards and Quality Assurance Framework; (f) Institutional and human capacity development. 1.2. Curriculum and Assessments subcomponent entails: (a) Curriculum reform; (b) Assessments of student learning outcomes. Subcomponent 1.3. will promote Gender Equality and Inclusive Education. 2. Teacher Management and Professional Development component seeks to address the critical teacher quality and workforce management issues facing the country. Both system- and school-level interventions will be supported through two subcomponents. 2.1. Teacher Workforce Planning and Teacher Management subcomponent will strengthen teacher workforce planning and implement teacher related policies. It will also assist the Teaching Service Commission (TSC) in developing a comprehensive and integrated teacher management information system (TMIS). 2.2. Teacher Professional Development subcomponent aims to improve the quality of classroom instruction across primary schools and Junior Secondary Schools (JSSs). Activities will include providing a solar-powered tablet or appropriate digital device to every primary a

description.narrative: Total Commitment in Second Quarter of 2020
Total Disbursement in Third Quarter of 2020

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months from the Effectiveness Date establish and thereafter maintain throughoutimplementation of the Project, a Multi-Donor Trust Fund Free Education Project Steering Committee (“MDTFSC”), with a composition,mandate, terms of reference and resources satisfactory to the Association.

The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months from the Effectiveness Date, establish and thereafter maintain throughout theimplementation of the Project, the Free Education Project Secretariat (FEPS) responsible for the day-to-day management andcoordination of the Project, with adequate resources, key staff including an environmental specialist, a social developmentspecialist, and a monitoring and evaluation specialist with qualifications, skills and terms of reference satisfactory to theAssociation.

target.value: New school quality standards rolled out

actual.value: School Quality Assurance Framework has been drafted.

title.narrative: Inclusive education policy developed and in use

target.value: Teacher training program using inclusive education policy

actual.value: Radical inclusion policy has been drafted.

baseline.value: Information of SMCs operation available on REDiSL supported schools

target.value: SMC manual revised based on evaluation results

actual.value: TOR for baseline study needs to be developed.

title.narrative: One national learning assessment (NLA) conducted and findings disseminated

baseline.value: No integrated national learning assessment (NLA) conducted

target.value: Results of NLA disseminated and used for learning improvement

actual.value: National assessment team has not been set up yet.

target.value: Associated transparent criterion-based school approval and financing process implemented

actual.value: School catchment area analysis is being done

target.value: Pedagogical feedback developed for the analysis at down to school level and provided to all approved schools

actual.value: Analysis report for NPSE has been published.
